name: Education and Social Transformation BA
overview: This major provides students with an understanding of the multiple facets of the educational landscape in social, cultural, and historical contexts. Students will learn the science of human development, how to interpret social data and research, engage respectfully with community partners, and design solutions to problems in education.
college: School of Education and Information Studies

sections.title: The Major
sections.description: Complete at least ten upper-division courses distributed as follows:

requirements.title: Areas of Competency
requirements.description: Select courses from each of the three areas of competency as follows:

options.title: Histories and Philosophies of Education
options.description: Complete Education 100 and at least one additional course from Education 101 through 119.

options.title: Contexts of Teaching, Learning, and Development
options.description: Complete Education 120 and at least one additional course from Education 121 through 149.

options.title: Inquiry and Design for Learning
options.description: Complete Education 150, 156, and at least one additional course from Education 151 through 155 or Education 157 through 169.

requirements.title: Additional Education Course
requirements.description: Select at least one additional course in education, which may come from any of the areas of competency or from courses designated as electives:

requirements.title: Community Engagement Course
requirements.description: Students must complete Education 180 prior to taking a community engagement course. Some courses may also be applied toward an area of competency. Select one community engagement course from the following list:

requirements.title: Capstone Course
requirements.description: Students must complete six out of seven courses from the areas of competency and complete the community engagement course requirement before enrolling in the capstone course.
